titleStmt.title: A trevve description of the nobill race of the Stevvards succedinge lineallie to the Croun of Scotland vnto this day: and novv this yeir 1603. vnto the croun of England: vvith thair lyvvelie portraturs, declaring exactlie vvhat tyme thay begane to reigne, hovv lange thay reigned, and of vvhat qualities thay vvere.
titleStmt.author: Johnston, John, 1570?-1611.

titleStmt.title: A trevve description of the nobill race of the Stevvards succedinge lineallie to the Croun of Scotland vnto this day: and novv this yeir 1603. vnto the croun of England: vvith thair lyvvelie portraturs, declaring exactlie vvhat tyme thay begane to reigne, hovv lange thay reigned, and of vvhat qualities thay vvere.
titleStmt.author: Johnston, John, 1570?-1611.

publicationStmt.publisher: Ad [sic] the expensis of Andro Hart buikseller in Edinbrugh,

notesStmt.note: A later state of the edition with undated colophon; "at least the texts under James VI and Anne of Denmark have been revised"--STC. These two states have prose captions in Scots prose. The plates were originally used in Johnston's "Inscriptiones historic√¶ regum Scotorum", which had Latin verse below the portraits.
Identified as STC 12886 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
